sentences: Sa peaksid alati vastutavad inimesi vaatama.
context: The Estonian word 'vaata' is the imperative form of the verb 'vaatama', which means 'to look' or 'to watch'. It's used as an informal command telling someone to look at something. The infinitive form is 'vaatama', and in past tense it would be 'vaatasin' (I looked/watched) or 'vaatasime' (we watched).
